articles.title: Innovative detection method makes AI smarter by cleaning up bad data before it learns
articles.summary: Innovative detection method makes AI smarter by cleaning up bad data before it learns. Support vector machines (SVMs) are widely used in everything from image and speech recognition to medical diagnostics and text classification. They rely on a small but crucial subset of the training data, known as support vectors, to determine the boundary between different categories of data. If a few examples are incorrectly labeled, the resulting decision boundaries can be flawed, leading to poor performance on real-world data.

articles.title: Veteran analyst unveils bold price target for Tempus AI stock

articles.summary: OpenAI, Google DeepMind and Anthropic are working on chatbots that tell people what they want to hear. They are trying to solve the growing problem of AI chatbots telling people what to say to them. The world's leading artificial intelligence companies are stepping up efforts to deal with the problem.

articles.title: Meta's $15 Billion Scale Deal Could Leave Gig Workers Behind

Apple's operating systems already include AI-powered features, from photo cleanup to call screening. What got everyone excited at WWDC 2024 were the advanced, personalized AI features that allow Siri to leverage a user's personal data and carry out actions on their behalf. Google announced a suite of personal AI features in May.

articles.title: Conveyor uses AI to automate the painful process of vendor security reviews and RFPs with AI

articles.title: Is Google Cloud a $1 Trillion Business?

The administration has already signaled limiting China's access to advanced AI technology.

Johan Schalkwyk, a machine learning lead at AI voice startup Sesame, and Alexandr Wang, co-founder and CEO of Scale AI, are also expected to be part of the team. articles.summary: New research from MIT Sloan uncovers when people prefer AI decision-making over that of humans and when they don't. People prefer human decisions even when AI performs better. People appreciate AI when it fits their utilitarian need to get the job done effectively and their psychological need to be recognized as a unique individual. AI aversion is more pronounced in countries with higher education and internet use.

articles.title: AI literacy: What it is, what it isn't, who needs it and why it's hard to define

articles.summary: President Donald Trump issued an executive order promoting AI literacy among Americans. According to the definition of AI literacy, it's a set of competencies that enables individuals to critically evaluate AI technologies and communicate and collaborate effectively with AI. It's not simply programming or the mechanics of neural networks, but a mix of knowledge, skills and attitudes that are technical, social and ethical in nature.

The foundational AI forecasting model ingests hundreds of millions of product-level data points daily to predict demand with tighter precision and stock the right items in the right fulfillment centers. articles.summary: Disney and Universal are suing the maker of an AI image-generation tool, Midjourney. articles.summary: Tech companies are tapping into the library stacks to train AI chatbots. Almost one million books published as early as the 15th century and in 254 languages are part of a new Harvard University collection being released to AI researchers Thursday. Tech companies are battling lawsuits from living novelists, visual artists and others whose creative works have been scooped up without their consent.

articles.title: Tech Giants' New AI Ad Tools Threaten Big Agencies
articles.author: Patrick Coffee

articles.title: Scientists develop electronic skin to give robots the feeling of human touch
